r.s: Create and Use PHP Archive files
r.d: PHP_Archive allows you to create a single .phar file containing an entire application.
r.n:
another major 32-bit/64-bit issue in PHP 5.1 where crc32() returns different values was causing some phars to fail.
This is *not* fixed in PHP 5.2, and won't be. This only affects CRCs. The workaround found is to sprintf("%u", crc32($data))
